page.title: 02FARMING - IN THE EGMERE AREA
page.content: There are{four farms}in the Egmere area.{Edgar Farm}, to the East, has 650 acres. It is owned by the Walsingham Estate Co. and is tenanted unlike the other farms which are all run by managers. It's predominantly arable but some pigs are kept. {Waterden Farm}, to the South-west, is part of the Holkham Estate. It has mixed farming. Beet, peas, wheat, barley and potatoes are grown. Beef cattle are reared.{Quarles Farm}is partly in the area - 700 of its 1,020 acres lie to the North-west. It also is part of the Holkham Estate. It is a mixed farm. Centrally placed{Egmere {Farm}has 720 acres and is owned by the Holkham Estate. It is arable. Cereal crops are grown as well as some sugar beet for the factory at King's Lynn. The soil is good and yields are high.
